use_cases_desc:
- "Tour" showcases interesting places to visit through an image gallery displayed in the public display, e.g. in a tourism office. 
- "Dress Shop" is for "a clothing store equipped with a public display, in which the products for sale in that shop are shown"
- "Car configurator [...] allows users to personalize a car model by selecting specific accessories, and receive associated price quotes"
contribution_desc:
The contribution are the design and implementation of a web framework that allows developers to implement cross-device gestures across multiple devices (i.e. a personal device and a public display). Mid-air gesture are supported via a Kinect v2 and touch gesture recognotion on devices are done via HammerJS. The communication between devices is done via WebSockets, a nodejs server manages the communication. 

Three example applications have been developed and a qualitative user-study with developers (students, researcher, etc) has been conducted to evaluated usefuleness and applicability of the toolkit.
use_cases: Tourism; Commercial (shopping); Car configuration (personalisation and shopping)
interaction_techniques: Data transfer/sharing; UI distribution; Cross-device task chaining; Remote control
crossdevice_def:
"devices can cooperate and coordinate with each other to encourage interaction with the information presented in public displays."

"cross-device gestures refers to gestures that are performed in multiple devices within some temporal constraint in order to obtain a combined gesture"

"Cross-device input and output [...] refer[s] to gestures that are performed on one device but their
effects change the user interface of another device as well"
